channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 The New York Times Company

item.title: World Briefing | Europe: Italy: Oldest Known Torah Scroll Found, Scholar Says
item.description: An Italian scholar said Wednesday that he had discovered the oldest known complete Torah scroll, dating from the 12th to the 13th century.
item.dc:creator: By GAIA PIANIGIANI

item.title: Salvadoran Court Denies Abortion to Ailing Woman
item.description: In a 4-to-1 ruling, El Salvador’s highest court said that “the rights of the mother cannot be privileged over those” of the fetus. But the woman’s lawyer described the decision as “misogynistic.”
item.dc:creator: By KARLA ZABLUDOVSKY and GENE PALUMBO

item.title: World Briefing | The Americas: Venezuela: New Details in Strip Club Shooting
item.description: The State Department said that one of the men wounded was a member of the United States armed services and the other was a civilian.
item.dc:creator: By WILLIAM NEUMAN

item.title: World Briefing | Europe: Bulgaria: Naming of Prime Minister Ends Stalemate
item.description: The Parliament elected Plamen Oresharski on Wednesday as prime minister, ending a three-month stalemate after the previous government resigned in February amid protests.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Wariness Over a Deal Intended to Deliver More Pork to China
item.description: A Chinese takeover of a large American pork producer has prompted concern about China’s expanding role in the American food supply and the implications that might have for food safety.
item.dc:creator: By STEPHANIE STROM
item.media:credit: Top from Left: J.Scott Applewhite/AP; Skip Nall/Digital Vision via Getty Images; Gerry Broome/AP; Mid from Left; J.Scott Applewhite/AP; Andrew Scrivani for the NYT: Genaro C. Armas/AP; Bot from Left: Fred R. Conrad/The NYT; Evan Sung for The NYT; Karsten Moran for The NYT

item.title: Chances of U.N. Peace Talks on Syria Appear Dim as Both Sides Dig In
item.description: As Syria’s foreign minister said President Bashar al-Assad would remain in office until elections next year and might even seek another term, the main opposition coalition said Mr. Assad must “step down.”
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By HALA DROUBI

item.title: Drone Strike Is Said to Kill a Pakistani Taliban Leader
item.description: A suspected American strike early Wednesday killed Wali ur-Rehman, the deputy leader, two Pakistani officials said, dealing a potentially serious blow to the insurgency.
item.dc:creator: By MARK MAZZETTI and DECLAN WALSH
item.media:description: Wali ur-Rehman, center, the deputy leader of the Pakistani Taliban, in 2011.

item.title: Otto Muehl, Actionist Artist, Dies at 87
item.description: Mr. Muehl’s art was sometimes considered a threat to public morality; at other times it was simply considered a threat to public safety.
item.dc:creator: By MARGALIT FOX

item.title: 2 Diplomats Treated Differently In Benghazi Uproar
item.description: Politics looms above all as one diplomat is reviled and the other is backed.
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER

item.title: Rodman Made North Korean Trip After Jordan Said No, H.B.O. Show Says
item.description: The creators of “Vice,” an HBO newsmagazine, said the former basketball star Dennis Rodman was asked to visit North Korea after Michael Jordan said no.
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE
item.media:description: Dennis Rodman near the Vatican in March.

item.title: Prosecutor in Argentina Says Iran Plotted With Hezbollah in Latin America
item.description: Alberto Nisman, who is investigating the 1994 bombing of a Jewish community center in Buenos Aires, said Iran had set up intelligence stations in Latin America to carry out terrorist attacks directly or through Hezbollah.
item.dc:creator: By SIMON ROMERO

item.title: Grindelwald Journal: In Swiss Alps, Glacial Melting Unglues Mountains
item.description: In a stark example of what’s happening to Switzerland’s glaciers, global warming is melting the ice that buttresses the mountains around Grindelwald, leading to rock slides and flood threats.
item.dc:creator: By JOHN TAGLIABUE
item.media:credit: Christoph Bangert for The New York Times
item.media:description: Tourists walking along a stream originating from the Lower Grindelwald Glacier in Switzerland. The glacier once extended through the gorge.

item.title: Staff Sgt. Robert Bales to Plead Guilty in Afghan Massacre
item.description: Staff Sgt. Robert Bales, charged with killing 16 civilians, will avoid the death penalty if military prosecutors agree to the plea, his lawyer said.
item.dc:creator: By JAMES DAO

item.title: Economist Sergei Guriev Leaves Russia Abruptly
item.description: Sergei Guriev was a co-author of a report that criticized the treatment of an imprisoned oil tycoon.
item.dc:creator: By ELLEN BARRY
item.media:description: The Russian economist Sergei Guriev last year.

item.title: 6 Bosnian Croats Convicted of Killing Muslims in ’92-95 War
item.description: A United Nations tribunal found that the former fighters persecuted Muslim civilians as part of an “ethnic cleansing” campaign in Bosnia ordered by Croatia’s leaders.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By MARLISE SIMONS

item.title: IHT Special: Palestinian Refugees Flee Syria to Find Poor Conditions in Lebanese Camps
item.description: The dismal Burj al-Barajneh camp in South Beirut has received some of the 56,000 Palestinians that have fled Syria.
item.category: United Nations High Commission for Refugees
item.dc:creator: By JOSH WOOD

item.title: World Briefing | Europe: Hundreds Celebrate France’s First Gay Marriage
item.description: The wedding came just 11 days after legislation permitting same-sex marriages and adoptions was signed into law by President François Hollande.
item.category: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
item.dc:creator: By SCOTT SAYARE
item.media:description: More than 200 journalists attended the wedding of Vincent Autin and Bruno Boileau.

item.title: Alan Gross, Cuba Prisoner, Loses Suit Against U.S.
item.description: With the dismissal of his case, Alan Gross may find it harder to pressure the United States to push for his release from a Cuban prison.
item.dc:creator: By DAMIEN CAVE

item.title: The Lede: Kremlin-Owned Network Hires Larry King
item.description: The news that the Russian government’s satellite news network Russia Today, or RT, has hired Larry King prompted a wave of derisive comments on Twitter.
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY and ANDREW ROTH

item.title: Insurgents Attack Red Cross Compound in Afghanistan
item.description: The violence shocked the Red Cross, which said it was the first time in its more than 30 years in Afghanistan that its offices had been attacked.
item.category: International Committee of the Red Cross
item.dc:creator: By AZAM AHMED
item.media:description: Smoke rose from the International Red Cross building in Jalalabad on Wednesday.

item.title: Was Wali ur-Rehman an ‘Imminent' Threat?
item.description: Wali ur-Rehman, deputy leader of the Pakistani Taliban, was killed by a drone strike in the North Waziristan area of Pakistan early Wednesday morning.

item.title: DealBook: Switzerland Considering a Deal With U.S. on Bank Secrecy
item.description: The proposed agreement with the United States includes a fine of at least $7 billion to $10 billion and the disclosure of the names of banks’ American clients.
item.dc:creator: By LYNNLEY BROWNING

item.title: Knife Attack, Not Vehicle Strike, Killed British Soldier, Police Say
item.description: The Metropolitan Police’s statement on the death of Lee Rigby included a public appeal for anyone who saw the car in the area or who witnessed the attack to come forward.
item.dc:creator: By STEPHEN CASTLE

item.title: U.N. Rights Council’s Resolution Calls for End to Fighting in Syrian Town
item.description: The Human Rights Council measure also condemns intervention by foreign fighters supporting the Syrian president, Bashar al-Assad.
item.dc:creator: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE

item.title: Henry Morgentaler, Abortion Doctor in Canada, Dies at 90
item.description: Dr. Morgentaler, who was heralded and vilified for his work and his views, won the landmark Canadian Supreme Court decision that legalized abortion nationally in 1988.
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT D. McFADDEN
